name: start-a-users-playback
description: Start a new context or resume current playback on the user's active device.

device_id.description: The id of the device this command is targeting. If not supplied, the user's currently active device is the target.
device_id.title: Device ID

context_uri.description:
Optional. Spotify URI of the context to play.
Valid contexts are albums, artists & playlists.
`{context_uri:"spotify:album:1Je1IMUlBXcx1Fz0WE7oPT"}`

offset.description:
Optional. Indicates from where in the context playback should start. Only available when context_uri corresponds to an album or playlist object
"position" is zero based and canâ€™t be negative. Example: `"offset": {"position": 5}`
"uri" is a string representing the uri of the item to start at. Example: `"offset": {"uri": "spotify:track:1301WleyT98MSxVHPZCA6M"}`

position_ms.description: Indicates from what position to start playback. Must be a positive number. Passing in a position that is greater than the length of the track will cause the player to start playing the next song.

uris.description:
Optional. A JSON array of the Spotify track URIs to play.
For example: `{"uris": ["spotify:track:4iV5W9uYEdYUVa79Axb7Rh", "spotify:track:1301WleyT98MSxVHPZCA6M"]}`
